p: The second binary plasmid was constructed to express the KS domain in Arabidopsis. It was comprised of three expression cassettes. The first cassette was to express the KS domain as a standalone protein with a chloroplast transit peptide from Arabidopsis fused to the N-terminus under the control of the seed-specific promoter. The second cassette was to express a kanamycin-resistance gene under the control of a constitutive promoter for selecting transgenic plants. The third cassette was to express a red fluorescent protein gene ( DsRed2) from Discosoma under the seed-specific promoter for screening transgenic seeds (Fig.Â 2b).
